005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.IDataTypeAdapter;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ICollectionValue;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidTypeFunctionException;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IAnyAtomicItem;
013import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.IItemType;
014import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
015
016import java.util.stream.Stream;
017
018import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
019
020/**
021 * The base interface inherited by all Metapath item implementations.
022 */
023public interface IItem extends ICollectionValue {
024  /**
025   * Get the type information for this item.
026   *
027   * @return the type information
028   */
029  @NonNull
030  static IItemType type() {
031    return IItemType.item();
032  }
033
034  /**
035   * Get the type information for the item.
036   *
037   * @return the item's type information
038   */
039  @NonNull
040  IItemType getType();
041
042  /**
043   * Get the item's "wrapped" value. This "wrapped" value may be:
044   * <ul>
045   * <li>In the case of an Assembly, a Java object representing the fields and
046   * flags of the assembly.</li>
047   * <li>In the case of a Field with flags, a Java object representing the field
048   * value and flags of the field.
049   * <li>In the case of a Field without flags or a flag, a Java type managed by a
050   * {@link IDataTypeAdapter} or a primitive type provided by the Java standard
051   * library.
052   * </ul>
053   *
054   * @return the value or {@code null} if the item has no available value
055   */
056  Object getValue();
057
058  /**
059   * Determine if the item has an associated value.
060   *
061   * @return {@code true} if the item has a non-{@code null} value or
062   *         {@code false} otherwise
063   */
064  default boolean hasValue() {
065    return getValue() != null;
066  }
067
068  @Override
069  default ISequence<?> toSequence() {
070    return ISequence.of(this);
071  }
072
073  /**
074   * Get the atomic value for the item. This may be the same item if the item is
075   * an instance of {@link IAnyAtomicItem}.
076   * <p>
077   * An implementation of
078   * <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-31/#id-atomization">item
079   * atomization</a>.
080   *
081   * @return the atomic value or {@code null} if the item has no available value
082   * @throws InvalidTypeFunctionException
083   *           with code
084   *           {@link InvalidTypeFunctionException#NODE_HAS_NO_TYPED_VALUE} if the
085   *           item does not have a typed value
086   */
087  // FIXME: get rid of the possible null result and throw
088  // InvalidTypeFunctionException#NODE_HAS_NO_TYPED_VALUE
089  IAnyAtomicItem toAtomicItem();
090
091  /**
092   * {@inheritDoc}
093   *
094   * @throws InvalidTypeFunctionException
095   *           with code
096   *           {@link InvalidTypeFunctionException#NODE_HAS_NO_TYPED_VALUE} if the
097   *           item does not have a typed value
098   */
099  @Override
100  default Stream<IAnyAtomicItem> atomize() {
101    return ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.of(this.toAtomicItem()));
102  }
103
104  @SuppressWarnings("null")
105  @Override
106  default Stream<? extends IItem> flatten() {
107    return Stream.of(this);
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * A visitor callback used to visit a variety of Metapath item types.
112   *
113   * @param visitor
114   *          the visitor to call back
115   */
116  void accept(@NonNull IItemVisitor visitor);
117
118  @Override
119  default ISequence<?> contentsAsSequence() {
120    return toSequence();
121  }
122}
